Sandro CAMPAGNA, Î³Î¹Î± ÏÎ·Î½ Î½Î¯ÎºÎ· ÏÎ¿Ï Ï ÎµÏÎ¯ ÏÎ·Ï ÎÏ ÏÏÏÎ±Î»Î¯Î±Ï.

Women's Discus Throw : Comments from medallists 22 Aug. 2004 ATHENS, 21 August - Comments from SADOVA (RUS), KELESIDOU (GRE), YATCHENKO (BLR) Natalya SADOVA (RUS)- Gold medal On what she was expecting to do at the Olympic Games final "I expected to win. And to throw near 68-69 meters because there have been good results this year in the discus throw. There were a lot of strong athletes chasing a medal in Athens" On the competition "My coach and I both expected that my first two throws would be the best at the final. But it did not work because I had problems with my technique. At my fourth try I managed to get it together and in the final two throws I was feeling very strong" On how she feels after winning the olympic gold medal "Just now I start to realise what happened" Anastasia KELESIDOU (GRE)- silver medal On how she felt during the competition "These are feelings that you can't describe if you don't live it. I thank God that I had the chance to experience this. It was amazing. I want to thank the people that came to the stadium for their help and support" On whether she is disappointed with winning a second silver medal "I am always trying for the best result. I really wanted the gold medal, but being on the medal podium for the second time at the Olympic Games is also very important. I am thankful for that" On whom she wanted to dedicate the medal "To all the Greeks. I wanted desperately to win a medal for my country. And especially to my parents and coach who have supported me all these years" On whether she was distracted by what happened with KEDERIS and THANOU "It is really sad. But I stopped reading newspapers and watching the TV, because I had an aim and I had to concentrate." Irina YATCHENKO (BLR)- Bronze medal On how she feels winning the bronze medal "Of course I am happy with that. The bronze is also a medal"
